revised_title: The Dieca Effect and Cytochrome System Changes in Barley Root Respiration
tldr: The authors studied the respiration of barley and wheat root tips and discovered a unique phenomenon called the "dieca effect" in barley. This effect occurs when the cytochrome system in young barley roots temporarily fails, leading to a change in oxidation mechanism without affecting growth or salt uptake. The study provides insights into the differences between barley and wheat root respiration and the role of the cytochrome system in plant tissues.
